channel.title: Comments on: Take the First Step
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: accidentaldba
item.dc:creator: accidentaldba
item.description: I could write a blog just on how you and the #SQLFamily inspired me years ago - and continue to do so every day. Being more involved with PASS this year has been great - 2014 is going to be even better. Charleston.sqlpass.org (Charleston PASS User Group) is doing great - the new job that I took is great - and getting my boss to #SUMMIT13 this year has inspired him to start a User Group in E-Town KY! Thank you - and Brent, and Jeremiah, and Kendra, and the entire #SQLFamily for helping me to take all of these huge leaps of faith.
item.content:encoded: I could write a blog just on how you and the #SQLFamily inspired me years ago – and continue to do so every day. Being more involved with PASS this year has been great – 2014 is going to be even better. Charleston.sqlpass.org (Charleston PASS User Group) is doing great – the new job that I took is great – and getting my boss to #SUMMIT13 this year has inspired him to start a User Group in E-Town KY! Thank you – and Brent, and Jeremiah, and Kendra, and the entire #SQLFamily for helping me to take all of these huge leaps of faith.

item.title: By: Jes Schultz Borland (grrlgeek)
item.dc:creator: Jes Schultz Borland (grrlgeek)
item.description: Cathrine - good luck with everything! Blogging is a wonderful way to share knowledge. Speaking is definitely scary, but remember this: everyone in the audience wants you to succeed. They are there to learn from you. You will do great! If I can help - let me know!
item.content:encoded: Cathrine – good luck with everything! Blogging is a wonderful way to share knowledge. Speaking is definitely scary, but remember this: everyone in the audience wants you to succeed. They are there to learn from you. You will do great! If I can help – let me know!

item.title: By: Jes Schultz Borland (grrlgeek)
item.dc:creator: Jes Schultz Borland (grrlgeek)
item.description: Frank, thank you for asking me to help. It's been a joy to watch your community participation grow!
item.content:encoded: Frank, thank you for asking me to help. It’s been a joy to watch your community participation grow!

item.title: By: skreebydba
item.dc:creator: skreebydba
item.content:encoded:
Jes,

Thanks for this and thanks for being the first to help me take that first step. It’s been a great three years.

Frank

item.title: By: Cathrine
item.dc:creator: Cathrine
item.content:encoded:
Thanks for posting! Your thoughts and experiences sound very familiar – thinking I have nothing to say that’s useful to others and being scared of presenting something that so many others know so much better. (And if that’s not scary enough, English is not even my first language!)

But I did take that small first step and started a blog, I went to PASS Summit and met some wonderful people, and I’ve signed up as a volunteer on my first ever SQLSaturday in 2014. I hope to take more first steps in other directions as well, and your post inspires me to just go for it. Thank you ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Chris Yates
item.dc:creator: Chris Yates
item.description: Nice article Jes, you've hit the nail right on the head in taking that first step. Always enjoy reading what you have to share.
item.content:encoded: Nice article Jes, you’ve hit the nail right on the head in taking that first step. Always enjoy reading what you have to share.
